call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - May 8th

decisions.decision: 6.0 soft fork voting will be made a default option due to messiness of current approach
decisions.speaker: kushti
decisions.context: Most miners indicated vote for 5.0 soft fork, but current voting approach would be quite messy
decisions.quote: But, yeah, well, currently it would be quite messy, so probably there will be just one version.

decisions.decision: Twitter spaces with coin Republic and crypto reach moved to Saturday
decisions.speaker: kushti
decisions.context: Issues on coin republic site yesterday caused postponement
decisions.quote: So we will have, Twitter spaces with, the coin Republic and, crypto reach on Saturday now.

commitments.commitment: 6.0 cleanup will be done and ready for voting proposal
commitments.quote: reviewing again 6.0, doing some cleanup and so on, so hopefully we'll be done by the end of the week
And then, yeah, we can propose watching to the polls, maybe from, I don't know, like end of May, June 1st

commitments.commitment: Deploy Dexy contracts one by one in mainnet
commitments.quote: Then, yeah, so for Dexy here, well, I'm rechecking contracts and deploying one by one in the mainnet.
So, well, let's try to roll out something maybe next week.

commitments.commitment: Deploy public devnet server for sub-blocks testing
commitments.quote: I can roll out maybe, so I can use some server of mine to deploy.

open_questions.question: Need for multiple miners in public testnet for sub-blocks competition testing
open_questions.context: Testing sub-blocks requires competition between miners but currently only one miner in public test

open_questions.question: Testing mixed scenario with some miners on sub-block supporting clients and others not
open_questions.context: Realistic scenario for mainnet deployment needs testing

open_questions.question: Whether to attend Token 2049 in Singapore

reversals_or_updates.reason: Issues on coin republic site and crypto reach had to cancel
reversals_or_updates.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: 6.0 will have two versions: with LevelDB and RocksDB
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: Hal Finny's birthday was May 4th, would have turned 60
key_facts.speaker: qx()

key_facts.fact: RocksDB supports fewer platforms than LevelDB but has better overall stability
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: LevelDB is used in Bitcoin Core, RocksDB is a fork of LevelDB
key_facts.speaker: kushti
